definition: to use/to employ/to have to/to eat or drink/expense or outlay/usefulness/hence/therefore

sentences.english: Kitten urgent need, hope in two days after double.
sentences.chinese: 小貓急用，希望在兩天內翻完。

sentences.english: She always has a dictionary by her for urgent use.
sentences.chinese: 她手頭總放着一本詞典以備急用。

sentences.english: Who VB source code decompilation tools, emergency, I give 100
sentences.chinese: 誰有VB源碼反編譯工具，急用，我給100分。

sentences.english: Save money for yourself in case of emergencies.
Have signaling equipment ready for immediate use.
sentences.chinese: 準備好信號設備，供急用。

sentences.english: Money is always scarce and there is none saved for emergencies.
sentences.chinese: 錢總是不夠用，根本不可能節省下來以備急用。

sentences.english: There is pressure by business groups to relax the "No haste, go slow" policy towards mainland China.
sentences.chinese: 企業團體施壓放寬對大陸的戒急用忍政策。

sentences.english: Insurance premiums are like money put aside for a rainy day.
sentences.chinese: 繳保費像是爲未來急用而預留的一筆錢。

sentences.english: I need a loan or overdraft to expand my business.
sentences.chinese: 我急用一筆貸款或者透支款，以擴展生意。

definition: a possible period of want or need
variant of 佣錢|佣钱[yong4 qian5]
to help/to do a favor/(Shanghainese) Come on!/Give me a break!
to have a cash flow problem
help the starving but not the poor (idiom)
